alert.note: Alert for Harnett; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 07 at 12:57PM EDT until April 07 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Harnett and Wake. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1253 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported continued flooding and road closures across southern Wake County and northern Harnett County. Portions of Purfoy Road are closed north of Holland Road. NC 55 near Delaney Hills Lane is also experiencing flooding. It will take several hours for runoff from this morning`s heavy rainfall to recede. While rainfall is light at the moment, additional moderate to heavy rainfall will overspread the area once again later this afternoon which could lead to additional flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Holly Springs, Duncan, Raven Rock State Park and Lake Benson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
